author: rjmholt
body:
From https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/703.

PowerShell apparently offers completions for some keywords, but not:
- `try`
- `catch`
- `finally`
- `continue`

Providing these would improve script authoring experience

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: Tangentially related and in the same vein as #7828 -- would be nice to have completions for all common error handling cases. 😄

comments.author: copdips
comments.body:
Just FYI,

There's `throw` auto completion for the `ThrowError` function in the preinstalled module `PSDesiredStateConfiguration`:

```powershell
6.1.0> gcm ThrowError

CommandType     Name          Version    Source
-----------     ----          -------    ------
Function        ThrowError    0.0        PSDesiredStateConfiguration        
```

comments.author: Cirzen
comments.body:
I would also request adding to this keywords for:

- `begin`
- `process`
- `end`

As autocompletion when writing these blocks for advanced functions frequently populates the editor with unintended code.

title: Add keyword completions for try/catch/throw/continue
